results.title: See me
results.brief_description: Catherine delves into the mind of a lady, once independent but now forced to adjust to a life of restriction and questions of a personal nature. This story touches on the universal need to be seen as a person, still full of life and potential, rather than a problem.
results.description: Catherine delves into the mind of a lady, once independent but now forced to adjust to a life of restriction and questions of a personal nature. This story touches on the universal need to be seen as a person, still full of life and potential, rather than a problem.

results.title: In search of golden footprints
results.creator_credit: Andrew Swift and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Andrew Swift was raised in a small mining town in the foothills of the Victorian Alpine country. The more he learnt about the history of mining in the region, the more his interest in the remote areas of the Alps increased. Andrew’s exploration of the area has unearthed evidence of the long forgotton gold mines and the stories of the people who worked there.

results.title: Home in the high country
results.creator_credit: Trevor Larner and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Trevor Larner first discovered the Victorian high country as a teenager. He initially wanted to get to the highest point, but then fell in love with the vegetation and beauty of the Alpine region. Eventually he started working there maintaining infrastructure, building ski lodges and repairing the huts of the early pioneers. When Trevor went back to visit in 2008, it felt like he was coming home.

results.title: Allan's "Westella"
results.creator_credit: Bob Barber, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: The sad occassion of the sale of the beloved family farm “Westella” gives Bob Barber cause to reflect on the times there. It was at “Westella” that Barber learnt many things about running farm, and where he could always get a feed.

results.title: The Dulugar
results.creator_credit: James Hackell and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: My love of stories and my love of the bush grew at the same time. Stories bring the land to life. A story about a man’s connection to his Indigenous ancestors through the Victorian Alpine country and the stories that would pass through the generations, especially the one about the Dulugar, a fierce creature said to exist in the region, haunting campers with their red eyes and devil-like smell.
results.description: My love of stories and my love of the bush grew at the same time. Stories bring the land to life. A story about a man’s connection to his Indigenous ancestors through the Victorian Alpine country and the stories that would pass through the generations, especially the one about the Dulugar, a fierce creature said to exist in the region, haunting campers with their red eyes and devil-like smell.

results.title: A Dream to create a home
results.creator_credit: Wendy Walters, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Wendy Walters and her group of passionate people set about building a home for ninety people in Mill Park, Victoria. Through the dreams and idealism is frustration at the struggle to make this building home for so many different people.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wendy Walters, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: It's time to go
results.creator_credit: Cheryl Seymour, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Seymour family had struggled for years to keep the farm viable, despite rising interest rates, falling prices, droughts and fires. As the family got older and circumstances changed, it was time to make an important decision.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cheryl Seymour, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Anything can happen in life
results.creator_credit: Zenebech Tebeje, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Zenebech Tebeje reflects on growing up in her large family and how quickly life can change. But if you can adapt and embrace your new life, you can do anything.
